jobs.title: Corporate Onboarding Specialist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
In 2018, Bitvavo launched the first version of its digital assets trading platform, to bridge the gap between traditional currencies and digital assets. By offering transparent fees, a wide range of assets and an easy to use platform, Bitvavo is making the currency of the future accessible for everyone.

In two years' time, Bitvavo has established itself as the market leader in the Netherlands and one of the largest in Europe, with over one million users exchanging tens of billions of digital assets a year.

Our team, located in Amsterdam, is looking for self-driven, talented people who can help make digital assets available for everyone.

What is the role about?

As a digital asset provider, Bitvavo has a responsibility to protect its clients against malicious actors, prevent money laundering and terrorist financing. As a firm offering service for the exchange between digital assets and regular money, we are subject to European anti-money-laundering laws and regulations and are supervised by the Dutch Central Bank. It is important to ensure that we comply with licensing requirements, internal policies and other prevailing laws. And that's where you come into play. 

As a Corporate Onboarding Specialist you will be part of our KYC & Onboarding team, which is part of our larger Operations team. The KYC & Onboarding team ensures the quality of our operational KYC processes.

The KYC & Onboarding team is responsible for the following:

  • Onboarding of private clients

  • Onboarding of corporate clients: responsibility of this role. 

  • Quality Assurance of the onboarding processes

You will face multiple challenges as we are growing quickly and are onboarding multiple complex corporate prospects every week. As it is key to comply with all regulations and best practices, you will play an essential role in ensuring this happens, together with our Professional Support Specialists, Business Development Managers, Financial Crime Officers and Compliance Officers. You will report to our Onboarding Manager. 

What you'll be doing? 

Within the KYC & Onboarding team you will be mainly focussed on:

  • Together with your team processing all KYC activities to ensure a smooth onboarding of our corporate clients

  • Conducting risk assessments and analysing potential threats while evaluating the likelihood of financial crimes and fraud

  • Performing CDD on corporate clients during their lifecycle

  • Implementing a data driven and automated approach to the onboarding process

  • Identifying and implementing ongoing improvements for performed KYC activities

  • Improving the knowledge and quality of KYC in the organisation

What we look for?

  • Preferably 3-5 years of working experience in KYC & CDD for corporate clients

  • Experience with data driven working and process automation

  • Demonstrated experience and knowledge of EU FEC and AML regulations

  • Prior experience with performing KYC activities and with procedures relating to corporate clients within a dynamic (FinTech) environment regulated by the Dutch Central Bank

  • Strong stakeholder management skills

  • Structured thinker that can prioritise issues and is an enthusiastic problem solver

  • Corporate Onboarding; Direct corporate onboarding and annual reviews, including standard and enhanced due diligence. Ensure comprehensive assessments and compliant onboarding files.

  • Quality Assurance: Oversee quality assurance programs across all KYC workflows. Regularly assess and enhance quality standards to drive operational excellence and identify gaps and implement process improvements for regulatory compliance

  • Fraud Prevention & Response: Ensure proactive measures to combat fraud, scams, and other fraudulent threats targeting clients. Oversee proactive initiatives and fraud prevention training, as well as reactive measures, including after-care services, to mitigate the impact of fraud and protect client assets.

  • Management Reporting & Analytics: Prepare and present detailed reports on team performance and compliance metrics. Leverage data analytics to identify trends and inform strategic decisions.   • Team Leadership & development: Lead, coach, and mentor the Onboarding teams, fostering accountability and encouraging professional growth and career development. Cultivate a culture of compliance awareness and operational excellence and conduct regular performance reviews and deliver constructive feedback.

  • Stakeholder management and collaboration: Partner with Compliance, Legal, Product, Engineering, and Business Development. Align KYC & CDD strategies with business objectives and regulatory standards. Streamline cross-departmental communication and processes and represent Onboarding in internal and external working groups.

What We Look For

  • 5+ years in senior KYC, CDD, or AML leadership within financial services, fintech, or crypto

  • Deep knowledge of KYC/AML regulations

We are seeking an experienced Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) to lead our cybersecurity efforts. The CISO will report directly to our Chief Risk Officer (CRO) board member, ensuring top-level integration of security into our strategic decisions. This role will work very closely with the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) as a major stakeholder, ensuring alignment between security initiatives and technology development. The ideal candidate will possess a strong technical background, proven leadership skills, strategic vision, and a commitment to continuous learning.

  • Technical Leadership: Develop and implement security solutions, architectures, and policies to protect the company's systems, customer data, and digital assets. Stay updated with emerging threats and industry best practices.

  • Strategic Vision: Align the security program with the company’s business objectives. Provide strategic guidance on security threats and risk management to the executive team.

  • Risk Management: Identify, assess, and mitigate risks associated with financial transactions, sensitive data, and regulatory compliance. Ensure the organization’s risk management practices are robust and proactive.

  • Adherence to relevant regulations: Ensure compliance with upcoming regulations such as DORA (Digital Operational Resilience Act) and MiCAR (Markets in Crypto-Assets Regulation). Develop effective policies and controls that align with these requirements, and work with the first line to implement them.

  • Pragmatic Approach: Demonstrated ability to strike the right balance between compliance requirements and engineering agility, driving pragmatic and effective solutions.

  • Communication: Articulate complex security concepts to non-technical stakeholders, including senior management and board members, in a clear and concise manner.

  • Incident Response: Develop and oversee incident response plans. Coordinate responses to security events and support post-incident analysis and remediation.

  • Collaboration with Engineering and Product Teams: Work closely with engineering and product teams to embed security early in the development lifecycle ("shift left"). Ensure that our products and services are secure by design and meet the highest security standards.

  • Continuous Improvement: Encourage innovation and continuous learning within the security team. Stay abreast of the latest security trends, technologies, and best practices through certifications, conferences, and industry networks.

  • Strategic Thinking: Ability to align security initiatives with business objectives. Experience in providing strategic guidance to senior leadership.

  • Risk Management: Strong skills in identifying, assessing, and mitigating security risks.

  • Compliance: Deep understanding of relevant regulations and standards within the financial sector (e.g., GDPR, ISO, SOC 2, NIST Cybersecurity Framework) and experience applying them to a technology-focused environment.

By offering transparent fees, a wide range of assets and an easy to use platform, Bitvavo is making the currency of the future accessible for everyone.

In two years' time, Bitvavo has established itself as the market leader in the Netherlands and one of the largest in Europe, with over one million users exchanging tens of billions of digital assets a year.

Our team, located in Amsterdam, is looking for self-driven, talented people who can help make digital assets available for everyone.

About the Opportunity

We are a rapidly growing engineering organisation making digital assets accessible to our customers. To meet the demands of our growing customer base and an increasing number of assets offered, we are expanding our core backend teams to drive innovation with a focus on designing and implementing cutting-edge low-latency services with an aim for enabling seamless customer experience.

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Implementing scalable secure cloud adoption - Partnering with engineering teams to design and implement secure, scalable systems on the cloud, ensuring strict requirements around latency, availability, and resilience are consistently met.

  • Architect security by design: Collaborate closely with platform and infrastructure teams to deeply understand their architectures, then work backward to design and embed scalable, cloud-native security controls.

  • Cross-functional security collaboration: Work in close partnership with other security functions, including Product Security and Security Operations (SOC), to ensure a holistic approach to risk management and threat mitigation.

  • Shape technology choices with security input: Contribute to decisions on cloud services, infrastructure, and tools ensuring security requirements are addressed.

  • Participate in operational rotations to resolve incidents and regular security findings in our production environment

What We Look For

  • Proven experience: 6+ years of hands-on experience in cloud security, with deep expertise in AWS. Experience in the Fintech sector is a strong plus.

  • Security services at scale: Track record of designing, building, scaling, and maintaining security solutions that strengthen overall cloud and platform security posture.

  • Cloud-native environments: Solid experience with container orchestration (Kubernetes) in cloud-first environments.

  • Automation and Infrastructure as Code: Proficiency with IaC tools (we use Terraform) and automation practices to build and secure infrastructure efficiently.

  • Collaboration and communication: Strong ability to engage with cross-functional stakeholders—from engineers to leadership—to understand requirements, drive security discussions, and influence architecture and decision-making.

  • Bonus skills: Open-source contributions, conference talks, and/or recognized security certifications (e.g., OSCP, CKM, CKS) are a plus.

At Bitvavo, we believe that diverse perspectives drive innovation, foster creativity, and lead to better outcomes. We are committed to building a team that reflects the diversity of the communities we serve and creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome applicants of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences. Regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, ability, or any other characteristic. Join us and be part of a team that values and celebrates your unique contributions.

Bitvavo does not accept resumes from staffing, search, or recruitment firms without a signed agreement. If you send us a resume without such an agreement, we may contact the candidate directly without any obligation whatsoever and no fee of any kind will be paid should we hire the candidate.

What We Offer

At Bitvavo, we believe in attracting, motivating and retaining talented people through market-competitive offerings that go beyond compensation alone. To learn more about our total rewards package and the benefits we offer, visit our Life at Bitvavo page.

About the Opportunity

Data is at the heart of decisions at Bitvavo. We are expanding our Product & Marketing Analytics team at Bitvavo and therefore we are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team. As a Data Analyst you will drive insights in the Product and Marketing domains, facilitating data driven decision making. Your analyses and proposals directly impact product optimisation and company growth strategies.In this role you will work together with Product Managers and their teams, Marketing Managers and their teams, Business Control, Data Engineers and other Data Analysts and Scientists.

What You’ll Be Doing

You act as an analytics business partner to the domain managers. This requires you to have a proactive, self-starting attitude. There is a lot of freedom to bring your expertise and ideas into practice. You will be responsible, amongst other things, for the following: 

  • Analyze data and derive actionable insights to solve business challenges and discover opportunities

  • Build dashboards and reports to track product performance and marketing campaigns

  • Analyze user behaviour across the funnel to identify growth opportunities

  • Help Product and Marketing Managers design, set, perform, and analyze experiments using statistical models

  • Develop strategies and predictive models that leverage data to optimize user-facing features

  • Collaborate with the data engineering team to enhance data sets and pipelines

What We Look For

  • 2-8 years of experience in a data analytics role, preferably in the product or marketing domain

  • An academic degree in a STEM related area: e.g. Mathematics, Computer Science, Econometrics, Business Analytics or similar

  • Data-driven mindset, ability to translate numbers into actionable insights

  • Ability to communicate complex data in a simple, impactful way

  • End-to-end understanding of databases, data warehouse development, and data transformation tools

  • Strong SQL skills, deep experience with BI tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, or similar)

  • Some experience in performing predictive modeling and machine learning using programming languages (R, Python) is a plus (e.g., libraries like sklearn/tensorflow/keras)

  • Eagerness to work in a fast-paced industry and company that grows rapidly

  • Interest in the consumer trading and crypto space

Bitvavo is on a mission to make digital assets accessible to everyone, and exceptional user experience is at the heart of how we deliver on that promise. As Director of User Experience & Design, you will play a critical leadership role in shaping the future of one of Europe’s fastest-growing digital asset platforms. Reporting to the Chief Product Officer, you will lead a multi-disciplinary department of designers, UX researchers, and UX writers, building systems and structures that elevate our user experience to the next level. This is an opportunity to drive design excellence, scale a growing team, and directly impact millions of users across the continent.

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Define and execute the UX and design strategy in close collaboration with the Chief Product Officer

  • Lead and scale a high-performing department of designers, researchers, and UX copywriters through a manager-of-managers structure

About the Opportunity

We are an exchange. System scalability, performance and engineering productivity matters in everything that we do. We empower our engineering teams by providing them with the right frameworks and tools to build high-quality, secure, and scalable solutions. We're seeking exceptional talent to join us in making this a reality.

What do we expect from an Engineering Manager

We expect Engineering Managers to be technical leaders who coach their teams to win. A winning team delivers with high quality, at a good pace, and with high engagement; all of which are interrelated. We also expect Engineering Managers to have a product mindset, capable of working backward from business requirements and translating them into products.

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Empower engineering teams to build scalable systems with strict requirements on latency, availability, and/or throughput.

  • Team up with engineering teams to uncover pain points, and then work backward to craft the best solution.

  • Enable engineering teams to fully own their systems by providing them with the capabilities to seamlessly deploy and closely observe their applications.

  • Leverage infrastructure as code and automation to build reproducible systems that are consistent across multiple environments.

  • Support your team in growing every day by providing them with constructive feedback, guidance, and sharing knowledge.

What We Look For

  • Product mindset. Ability to translate business requirements into efficient and scalable technical solutions, ensuring alignment with company goals.

  • Strong technical background with one or more programming languages. We mostly use Kotlin.

  • Strong foundation in engineering principles, capable of guiding teams to design, build, and maintain high-quality systems.

  • Experience in optimising workflows through automation and continuous improvement, ensuring streamlined processes and delivery.

  • Exceptional leadership and communication skills. We expect both engineering managers and engineers to talk to various stakeholders to derive requirements, drive discussions, and facilitate decision-making processes effectively.

  • High sense of ownership and accountability. We expect engineering managers to lead by example, empowering your team with freedom and responsibility.

We're far more interested in your capabilities as a manager rather than in your specific knowledge of a certain tool and/or technology. Not sure if you tick all the boxes? Let's talk.

This position is based in Amsterdam, Netherlands, option of a full-time remote work is not possible.

About the Opportunity

Bitvavo is strengthening its Risk Management function with a dedicated Financial Risk Officer. While your primary focus will be on Market Risk, you will also have the opportunity to contribute to Liquidity and Credit Risk initiatives, making this a versatile and impactful role within our risk team.
You will join a multidisciplinary Risk team that partners with Trading, Treasury, Product, Data and Compliance to keep Bitvavo’s market-, credit- and liquidity-risk profile safely inside the limits set by the Management Board. This role is well-suited to an experienced risk professional who wants to take ownership, drive frameworks forward, and contribute to high-level decision-making.
Your mandate is broad: design and own the market-risk framework across our spot exchange, staking & lending products, and margin programme for institutional clients. You will translate senior management’s risk appetite into clear metrics, monitor exposures intraday, challenge the first line when limits are approached and provide the Risk Committee with forward-looking insight.

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Own the market-risk framework – Maintain and enhance policies, methodologies and limits (VaR, stress scenarios, liquidity adjusted exposure, concentration limits).

  • Contribute across risk types – Support initiatives in liquidity risk (funding gaps, contingency planning) and credit risk (counterparty reviews, concentration risk)

  • Build and run monitoring & reporting – Produce daily risk dashboards; investigate limit breaches, propose remedial action and escalate to the Risk Committee.

  • Independent product review – Assess financial-risk implications of new products (e.g. new asset listings, structured staking, perpetual futures) and material changes to existing services.

  • Stress testing & reverse stress testing – Develop macro-/micro-driven scenarios (flash crashes, liquidity dries-up, stable-coin de-pegs) that reflect crypto-specific behaviours; present actionable insights to senior leadership.

  • Model governance & margin design – Validate and enhance models (VaR, margin, back-testing, benchmarking, sensitivity analysis), align with regulatory/industry standards, and cooperate with business-stakeholders for Model Validation.

  • Link risks together – Quantify how market moves propagate into liquidity needs (margin calls, withdrawals) and credit exposures, working with Treasury and other stakeholders.

  • Cryptocurrency Exchange - Review new listings and product governance, Monitor Market Makers, Liquidity Providers and retail exposures and escalate accordingly.

  • Stakeholder influence – Translate technical risk metrics into clear business insights for senior management, regulators, and external stakeholders.

What We Look For

  • 5+ years of risk management experience, ideally in a trading firm, crypto exchange, investment bank, fintech, or similar financial institution.

  • Broad knowledge across market, liquidity, and credit risk – with the ability to connect the dots rather than focus narrowly on one area.

  • Deep understanding of portfolio risk metrics (VaR & alternatives), stress testing, scenario design and margining.

  • Good understanding on how an exchange operates, margin trading, lending and staking service and product knowledge.

  • Proven ability to communicate effectively with senior stakeholders, simplifying complex risk concepts into actionable insights.
